author: G Narasimha Rao
text:
Two members of the banned CPI (Maoist), one carrying a reward of Rs. 4 lakh on her head, and another Rs. 1 lakh, surrendered before Superintendent of Police Koya Praveen here on Friday.

An active member of the Maoist outfit in different areas in Andhra Pradesh and Odisha and also of the party’s cultural wing Jana Natya Mandali, Gemmeli Bundo alias Kamala alias Rasso, and a member of the Galikonda area committee Vanthala Saalu alias Balayya, surrendered. The former surrendered due to health problems and the latter because he found life difficult in the party.

Kamala (26), a native of Toomulova village under Boodaralla Panchayat in Koyyuru mandal, joined the Galikonda AC as an armed militia member in 2007. .

Balayya (19) of Chukkagoyyi village in G.K. Veedhi mandal, joined the Maoist outfit at a very young age. He joined the armed militia of Galikonda area committee and later became a full member of the area committee.Six months ago, he deserted the party as he found life difficult.
title: Two Maoists surrender in A.P.
